level.text: Each person selling coal as an agent shall secure a license for each year or part of a year.
No license shall be issued to any person to sell coal as an agent except as the agent of a licensed coal dealer.
Each application shall contain the following information:
The name and address of applicant;
The name and address of dealer for whom the applicant will sell coal, with the number of that dealer’s license;
The length of time applicant has been selling coal, if any;
The names and addresses of employers for the past five (5) years;
Crimes of which the applicant has been convicted, if any;
Whether the applicant has ever secured a license from any other District department and which department;
The names and addresses of at least three (3) references;
A statement from the dealer setting forth that the applicant is the dealer’s authorized agent; and
Any other information required by the Mayor.
Each application for a license as agent to sell coal shall be made on a form prescribed by the Mayor.
Each application shall be sworn to before an officer authorized to administer oaths.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Commissioners’ Order 298,901/1, issued March 7, 1939, 5X DCRR §§1.2a and 1.2b.
